revised_title: Experiments on Conductive Properties of Ice in Discovery Bay
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the rate of heat conduction through sea and fresh-water ice in Discovery Bay. They used a simple apparatus and various thermometers to measure the temperature changes. The results provided a rough method for estimating the absolute rate of conduction and contributed to the understanding of ice's conductive properties.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Glaciology and Cryology
